title: What innovations or technologies from China have been accepted by the USA? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here’s a pretty good list you can sort out which apply to the US. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Chinese_inventions Some that struck me are: Paper, printing, gunpowder, compass, alcoholic beverages, bells, coffins, pottery, fired bricks, rowing oar, steamer, rammed earth, soybean cultivation, rice paddies, acupuncture, artillery, banknotes, bellows, belt drive, biological pest control, blast furnaces, bombs, toothbrush, ship bulkheads, canon, cast iron, chain stitching, chopsticks, use of chromium, golf, civil service exams, metal fusion, coke fuel, color printing, crankshaft, crossbow, football, dental amalgam, yo-yo, dominoes, drilling rig, dry docks, clock escapement, exploding cannonball, fishing reel, flame thrower, flares, forensic entomology, fragmentation bomb, fuses, gas cylinder, gas lighting, gimbal, fan, hand grenade, handgun, farming harrow, helicopter rotor, horse harness, hygrometer, ink, inoculation, irrigation, ship keel, land mines, match, modular architecture, moveable sails, multi-stage rockets, naval mines, arch bridge, oil refining, oil well, paper cup, paper napkin, parachute, percussion drilling, pinhole camera, playing cards, pontoon bridge, relief maps, rockets, ships rudder, seisometer, snap fastener, snow gauge, solid propellent rockets, soybean oil, soy sauce, steel, stirrup, suspension bridge, tea, tofu, toilet paper, umbrella, hot air balloons, water tight compartments, wheelbarrow, and more. There are newer inventions listed also, from 1912. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Chinese_inventions
Book printing. For the complete list, please refer to Prof. Joseph Needham's “Science and Civilisation in China “
